page.title: 05MORE AMENITIES IN EARDISLEY
page.content: Eardisley{telephone exchange}is about 10 years old.It is an automatic Strowger exchange.On 1.7.1985 there were 505 lines connected.There are 40 junction circuits to Hereford and 12 to Kington.In 1940 there was a manual exchange at the Post Office. The{Post Office}has been on the same site and in the same family since 1918 The lady runs it alone.To have a holiday she must get a relief.She sells the same as a large P.O. Pensioners are her most regular customers.Many passersby use the P.O. because it is easy to park.The post box is emptied twice a day.The post goes to Kington first,then to Hereford There is a{police}house in Eardisley with a resident woman police constable She is based at Kington and covers a wide area in her police car which is linked to the computer at Worcester.
